alert.note: Alert for Labette; Neosho (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 2:25PM CDT until May 27 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Neosho River near Parsons affecting Neosho and Labette Counties. For the Neosho River...including Iola, Chanute, Erie, Parsons, Oswego...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neosho River near Parsons. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Significant flooding of the flood plain begins to occur affecting agricultural fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday morning to a crest of 21.1 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Neosho River Parsons 21.0 8.3 Tue 1 pm CDT 12.7 21.1 17.4 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
